data.name: AbuCompressedAirTitle
data.value: 4.4. Compressed air

data.name: AbuCompressedAirValue1
data.value: Compressed air consumption per one ABU unit does not exceed 80 N<sup>3</sup>/h.

data.name: AbuCompressedAirValue2
data.value: Provide a 15 mm in diameter pipeline to supply ABU with compressed air.

data.name: AbuCompressedAirValue21
data.value: Compressed air requirements:

data.name: AbuCompressedAirValue22
data.value: Pressure between 2 - 7 atm.

data.name: AbuCompressedAirValue23
data.value: Should contain no greater than 10 mg/m<sup>3</sup> of suspended substances.

data.name: AbuCompressedAirValue24
data.value: Moisture content – no requirements.

data.name: AbuCompressedAirValue3
data.value: Compressed air requirements:

data.name: AbuCompressedAirValue4
data.value: A suitable valve for an air supply point is supplied, except for the manifold valve.

data.name: AbuCompressedAirValue5
data.value: Compressed air should be supplied 24/7. Maximum allowed time without compressed air supply is no greater than 2 hours. A situation when an ABU unit is deprived of compressed air for longer than 2 hours is defined as abnormal. The necessary procedures for resolving abnormal situations are outlined in the ABU’s passport/documentation.

data.name: AbuDimensions
data.value: 1. ABU-{0} technical characteristics and overall dimensions

data.name: AbuElectricalConsumptionTitle
data.value: 2. ABU-{0} Consumables and Electricity Requirements

data.name: AbuElectricalConsumptionValue1
data.value: Electricity consumption is {0} kW, including a ventilator {1} kW

data.name: AbuElectricalConsumptionValue2
data.value: Depending on the temperature and humidity of the purified air, ABU requires no greater than {0} m<sup>3</sup>/day of service water to compensate for the water loss during operations.

data.name: AbuElectricalConsumptionValue3
data.value: No greater than {0} Nm<sup>3</sup>/hour of compressed air is required with 0.2 – 0.7 MPa pressure. Upon request, your ABU unit can come with an installed autonomous blower.

data.name: AbuElectricalConsumptionValue4
data.value: Between {0} kg per year of biogenic additives are required for ABU operations. A variety of agricultural fertilizers containing ammonium, phosphate and potassium ions are used as biogenic additives.

data.name: AbuElectricityTitle
data.value: 4.2 Electricity Requirements

data.name: AbuElectricityValue1
data.value: Electric Supply:

data.name: AbuElectricityValue11
data.value: Ventilator engine (1 pc., 380 V, {0} kW)

data.name: AbuElectricityValue12
data.value: Water pump engines (1 pc., 380 V, {0} kW)

data.name: AbuElectricityValue13
data.value: Sludge pump engines (1 pc., 380 V, {0} kW)

data.name: AbuElectricityValue14
data.value: ABU electric valve drivers – 9 pcs., 220 V, 100 W. (combined consumption for all 9 pcs.)

data.name: AbuElectricityValue15
data.value: Level sensors – 3 pcs, 6 W (combined consumption for all 3 pcs.)

data.name: AbuElectricityValue16
data.value: Power cables, cable trays, and control cables are supplied with ABU.

data.name: AbuElectricityValue2
data.value: Control cabinets are also supplied with ABU.

data.name: AbuElectricityValue3
data.value: Provide power circuit wiring from workshop’s transformer to ABU’s control cabinets.

data.name: AbuElectricityValue4
data.value: Both the power and start-up equipment for the pump and the ventilator should be installed in accordance to the «Electrical Equipment Installation Rules» and in locations that allow for monitoring of such equipment.

data.name: AbuElectricityValue5
data.value: Provide grounding busbars for all ABU non-conducting parts.

data.name: AbuInstallationTitle1
data.value: 4. ABU-{0} Initial Installation Requirements.

data.name: AbuInstallationTitle2
data.value: 4.1. Assembly and Premise Requirements

data.name: AbuInstallationValue1
data.value: Provide concrete flooring at the 0.000 mark for ABU placement. The floor should be leveled using the Level instrument. Thickness of the concrete floor will depend on the projected ABU load. ABU is installed on two frames.

data.name: AbuInstallationValue2
data.value: The load per frame is no greater than {0} tones.

data.name: AbuInstallationValue3
data.value: No floor attachments are required.

data.name: AbuInstallationValue4
data.value: Provide drainage traps in the concrete floor in case of an emergency spillage. The traps should be connected to the workshop’s sewerage system. An emergency spillage is defined as a leakage in the body of the tank or a leakage in the flow shut-off and control valves and related systems.

data.name: AbuInstallationValue41
data.value: No greater than 8 m<sup>3</sup> of spillage will be produced per one emergency.

data.name: AbuInstallationValue5
data.value: No hoisting mechanisms are required for ABU maintenance.

data.name: AbuInstallationValue6
data.value: Ambient room temperature for an ABU should not be less than +5°C during the coldest month of the year, and also should not exceed the +30°C mark.

data.name: AbuInstallationValue7
data.value: ABU installation room should adhere to lowest fireproof and explosion proof category requirements (the room contains cold and/or incombustible substances and materials in such amounts that the fire load does not exceed 100 mJ/m<sup>2</sup> in their respective locations, and the fire load of the entire room is under 1000 mJ.)

data.name: AbuLifespanTitle
data.value: 5. Life cycle

data.name: AbuLifespanValue
data.value: Service cycle is at least 15 years.

data.name: AbuMaintenanceTitle
data.value: 3. ABU-{0} Maintenance

data.name: AbuMaintenanceValue
data.value: ABU maintenance is limited to cleaning its sludge basket from condensed and suspended substances, as well as maintaining a required concertation of phosphorus, nitrogen and potassium in the absorbent by adding biogenic additives (BAs). It is recommended to conduct monthly measurements of phosphorus ions, nitrogen, and potassium to determine if BAs should be added to the absorbent. An indirect indicator (chemical oxygen consumption: COC) is used to gauge absorbent regeneration efficiency by the microorganism. It is also recommended to measure COC on a monthly basis.

data.name: AbuPhenolEfficiencyTitle
data.value: Capturing efficiency for phenol and formaldehyde:

data.name: AbuPhenolEfficiencyValue
data.value: At least {0}% given input concentration of {1} mg/m<sup>3</sup>

data.name: AbuSpecTitle
data.value: Technical Characteristics and Initial Parameters

data.name: AbutDrainageTitle
data.value: Composition of an emergency spillage is as follows:

data.name: AbutDrainageValue1
data.value: No greater than 150 mg/litre of phosphates

data.name: AbutDrainageValue2
data.value: No greater than 200 mg/litre of nitrates

data.name: AbutDrainageValue3
data.value: pH value between 6.5 - 8.3

data.name: AbutDrainageValue4
data.value: Chemical Oxygen Consumption (COC) no greater than 6,000 mg O<sub>2</sub>/litre

data.name: AbutDrainageValue5
data.value: Contains no greater than 0.1% by volume of suspended substances with particles’ size of less than 0.2 mm.

data.name: AbuTitle
AbuTriethylamineEfficiencyTitle
data.value: Purification efficiency against triethylamine and suspended substances between 96% - 99.9% (output triethylamine concertation is no greater than mg/m<sup>3</sup>)

data.name: AbuTriethylamineEfficiencyValue1
data.value: Capturing efficiency for suspended substances - at least 98%

data.name: AbuTriethylamineEfficiencyValue2
data.value: Ventilating network resistance: no greater than 1700 Pa

data.name: AbuTriethylamineEfficiencyValue3
data.value: Hydraulic resistance (ABU’s pressure loss): no greater than 2400 Pa

data.name: AbuTriethylamineEfficiencyValue4
data.value: Temperature requirements for ABU operations: between +5°C and +30°C

data.name: AbuTriethylamineEfficiencyValue5
data.value: ABU dimensions in mm if installed as a single unit (Length, Width, Height): {0}x{1}x{2}

data.name: AbuVentilationTitle
data.value: 4.5. Ventilation

data.name: AbuVentilationValue1
data.value: Provide air ducts to supply ventilated air from your manufacturing line to ABU, and then from ABU to the atmosphere.

data.name: AbuVentilationValue11
data.value: Air ducts are class «N» (normal).

data.name: AbuVentilationValue12
data.value: The class of air duct structure on the pressure line (after the ventilators) is «N» (normal) class.

data.name: AbuVentilationValue13
data.value: Flexible inserts for the ventilator input and output are supplied with the ABU.

data.name: AbuVentilationValue2
data.value: As a thrust actuator, ABU is using {0} ventilator with the following characteristics:

data.name: AbuVentilationValue21
data.value: engine {0} kW, 380/660V, 50Hz, {1} rpm

data.name: AbuVentilationValue22
data.value: the ventilator is made of carbon steel with a powder coating

data.name: AbuVentilationValue23
data.value: ventilator impeller rotation speed is {0} rpm

data.name: AbuVentilationValue24
data.value: {0} ventilator’s noise level is 113 dB.

data.name: AbuVentilationValue25
data.value: An alternative thrust actuator produced by another manufacturer with different characterises can also be used.

data.name: AbuVentilationValue3
data.value: Pressure at the ABU’s ventilating air intake and exhaust points is no greater than –1200 Pa and +500 Pa, respectively.

data.name: AbuVentilationValue4
data.value: Shutter closing needs to be arranged on the ducts, in the area of enclosures, to regulate the aspiration air leakage. Fittings counter flanges for the inlet and exhaust areas are supplied with ABUs.

data.name: AbuVentilationValue41
data.value: ABU room should have an installed ventilation system capable of providing 3-4 air changes per day.

data.name: AbuWaterSupplyTitle
data.value: 4.3. Water supply

data.name: AbuWaterSupplyValue1
data.value: Provide for industrial water supply to ABU Ду 20 fitting for a one-time filling of the tanks (about 20 m<sup>3</sup>) when the ABU is started.

data.name: AbuWaterSupplyValue2
data.value: Compensatory water consumption by the ABU - 2.0 m<sup>3</sup>/day max.

data.name: AbuWaterSupplyValue3
data.value: Requirements for industrial water to be used as additional feeding:

data.name: AbuWaterSupplyValue31
data.value: pressure - 0.2-0.6 MPa;

data.name: AbuWaterSupplyValue32
data.value: mechanical impurities content - 0.1% max by volume, particle size - 0.2 mm max;

data.name: AbuWaterSupplyValue33
data.value: Temperature between +5°С and +30°С

data.name: AbuWaterSupplyValue34
data.value: The ABU needs to be connected to the local water supply system through the manifold valve Ду 20mm.

data.name: AbuWaterSupplyValue4
data.value: A suitable valve for a water feed point is supplied, except for the manifold valve.

data.name: AbuWaterSupplyValue5
data.value: With the ABU absorption system running (pump and ventilator are ON), service water intended for compensatory supply can be absent for 2 hours max. If the absorption system is not running (pump and ventilator are OFF), additional supply of water is not required.
